description.narrative: Average number month during spawning season of illegal sturgeon poaching incidents or violation of fishing permits occurring in GizilAgaj

comment.narrative:
Spring gt8
Autumn gt6

Spring lt2
Autumn lt2

51 cases of illegal sturgeon poaching were registered by an authorised service of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources The reported data however show the total number of illegal incidents for both winter and spring seasons The Project Team will request the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources to provide data disaggregated by seasons for the next reporting period

Spring lt2
Autumn lt2

51 cases of illegal sturgeon poaching were registered by an authorised service of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources The reported data however show the total number of illegal incidents for both winter and spring seasons The Project Team will request the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources to provide data disaggregated by seasons for the next reporting period

description.narrative: Average number monthyear of cattle illegally grazing in GizilAgaj

comment.narrative: gt500month
lt10month

653 cases of cattle illegal grazing in GizilAgaj were registered by the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources during the entire year or 54 illegal incidents per month on average Even though the reported monthly average is still significantly high compared to the EoP target of 10 it is already significantly lower than the baseline indicator
lt10month

653 cases of cattle illegal grazing in GizilAgaj were registered by the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources during the entire year or 54 illegal incidents per month on average Even though the reported monthly average is still significantly high compared to the EoP target of 10 it is already significantly lower than the baseline indicator

description.narrative: Number of business plans operational in individual marine and coastal national parks

comment.narrative:
0
Development of business plans is scheduled at later stages of project implementation The reason being that initially the protected area should be provided with currently absent basic equipment capacity building and grown ownership of the projected area As initial surveys are shown reflected in the baseline surveys no business plans are yet for the marine protected areas in Azerbaijan There is no respective expertise in Azerbaijan yet Therefore the project team is in the process of development of the respective ToR to hire an international expert to assist the MENR and the Project Team in the development of business plan There is a positive feeling based on the steps already made that the planned target will be achieved

0

NGOs 2
Private sector 2

Donor agencies 2
NGOs 1
Private businesses 0
The Project inception workshop was held in Baku with participation of many stakeholders Also the project conducted a meeting with the local community in Baligchilar settlement during the reporting period After the meeting with the local community the idea emerged to conduct the meeting also with the schoolchildren and their teachers at the local school This meeting was also held successfully with QA session following the information session with the respective prices for the most knowledgeable students However no new partners emerged yet during first year of implementation It is expected that there will be enhanced participation in the coming years of project implementation

description.narrative: Incomeannum US by source from marine and coastal protected areas

comment.narrative:
Government US480822
Donors US277720
Entry fees US3902
Tourism services US0
Fines US45356
Resource use US0
Concessions US0
baseline year 20112012

Government gtUS750000
Donors gtUS500000
Entry fees gtUS15000
Tourism services gtUS10000
Fines gtUS75000
Resource use gtUS10000
Concessions gtUS10000
target year 201617

According to the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources the reported income by source is as follows
GovernmentUS545523
DonorsUS190000
Entry feesUS 2611
Tourism servicesUS0
FinesUS40833
Resource use US0
Concessions US0
The decrease in the donor funding for the marine protected areas is explained by the fact that donor funding varies between years depending on the particular activities and expenses planned for that particular year In some years there is an increase and in some years some decrease in donor funding depending on particular steps This decrease is not an indicator of diminishing attention to the marine protected areas on the side of donors
In turn the small decrease in the entry fees is explained mainly by the exchange rate change between USD and the local currency The decrease is attributed mainly to the exchange rate change Current 2611 by taking into account 34 local currency devaluation would bring current fees to 3499 AzN slightly below the baseline amount of 3902 Also not forget that the number of tourists also varies between years therefore depending on many trivial reasons like weather during holiday period or something else Still the MENR pays attention to this issue and the last year made necessary changes in the regulation allowing now for visitors to buy entrance tickets directly from the National parks The MENR understands that such a low entrance fee collection is unsatisfactory and takes measures to increase the entrance fee collection by using propaganda and easing access to the sites

Government gtUS750000
Donors gtUS500000
Entry fees gtUS15000
Tourism services gtUS10000
Fines gtUS75000
Resource use gtUS10000
Concessions gtUS10000
target year 201617

According to the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources the reported income by source is as follows
GovernmentUS545523
DonorsUS190000
Entry feesUS 2611
Tourism servicesUS0
FinesUS40833
Resource use US0
Concessions US0
The decrease in the donor funding for the marine protected areas is explained by the fact that donor funding varies between years depending on the particular activities and expenses planned for that particular year In some years there is an increase and in some years some decrease in donor funding depending on particular steps This decrease is not an indicator of diminishing attention to the marine protected areas on the side of donors
In turn the small decrease in the entry fees is explained mainly by the exchange rate change between USD and the local currency The decrease is attributed mainly to the exchange rate change Current 2611 by taking into account 34 local currency devaluation would bring current fees to 3499 AzN slightly below the baseline amount of 3902 Also not forget that the number of tourists also varies between years therefore depending on many trivial reasons like weather during holiday period or something else Still the MENR pays attention to this issue and the last year made necessary changes in the regulation allowing now for visitors to buy entrance tickets directly from the National parks The MENR understands that such a low entrance fee collection is unsatisfactory and takes measures to increase the entrance fee collection by using propaganda and easing access to the sites

description.narrative: To improve the management effectiveness including operational effectiveness and ecosystem representation of Azerbaijans coastal and marine protected area system with due consideration for its overall sustainability including ecological institutional and financial sustainability
Financial sustainability scorecard for national system of protected areas

comment.narrative: gt35

15
Though the Project Document has been signed by the Government in June 30 2014 its implementation has been delayed to the late appointment of the Project Director and then the creation of the Project Team During the first year of implementation main activities were concentrated on the purchase of the very basic required equipment like portable water meter cars and electronic equipment for the team Therefore the financial sustainability of the project remains at the baseline level Positive changes are expected and they will be reported by the midterm evaluation
gt35

15
Though the Project Document has been signed by the Government in June 30 2014 its implementation has been delayed to the late appointment of the Project Director and then the creation of the Project Team During the first year of implementation main activities were concentrated on the purchase of the very basic required equipment like portable water meter cars and electronic equipment for the team Therefore the financial sustainability of the project remains at the baseline level Positive changes are expected and they will be reported by the midterm evaluation

description.narrative: Total annual budget HR OPEX and CAPEX allocation for marine and coastal PAs USha

comment.narrative:
All PAs US303ha
GizilAgaj US 253ha

All PAs gtUS4ha
GizilAgaj gtUS4ha

All PAs US311ha
GizilAgaj US 197ha
At first sight it looks like the total annual allocations for Marine and Coastal Protected areas has increased overall but decreased for GizilAgaj In reality however in AzN terms local currency of Azerbaijan the funding for all marine and costal areas including GizilAgaj area has increased In February 2015 AzN depreciated by 34 against the dollar Therefore if calculated using the exchange rate before AzN depreciation respective numbers for all marine protected areas would be 416ha 311x134416 and for Gizilagaj 264ha 197x134264

All PAs gtUS4ha
GizilAgaj gtUS4ha

All PAs US311ha
GizilAgaj US 197ha
At first sight it looks like the total annual allocations for Marine and Coastal Protected areas has increased overall but decreased for GizilAgaj In reality however in AzN terms local currency of Azerbaijan the funding for all marine and costal areas including GizilAgaj area has increased In February 2015 AzN depreciated by 34 against the dollar Therefore if calculated using the exchange rate before AzN depreciation respective numbers for all marine protected areas would be 416ha 311x134416 and for Gizilagaj 264ha 197x134264
